title: Top billionaires who added the most billions to their wealth in 2024: No 1 is no surprise - CNBCTV18
summary:
Top billionaires who added the most billions to their wealth in 2024: No 1 is no surprise

Date: December 12, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

As of December 12, 2024, Mark Zuckerberg's net worth increased by $94.8 billion, fueled by Meta's advancements in the metaverse and artificial intelligence technologies. Other billionaires also saw significant increases in their wealth due to various factors related to their industry performances.

  • 1. Elon Musk - Net Worth: $442.3 billion (+$213.2 billion)
  • 2. Jeff Bezos - Net Worth: $247.9 billion (+$71 billion)
  • 3. Mark Zuckerberg - Net Worth: $222.9 billion (+$94.8 billion)
  • 4. Larry Ellison - Net Worth: $195.4 billion (+$72.5 billion)
  • 5. Larry Page - Net Worth: $171.1 billion (+$44.7 billion)
  • 6. Jim Walton - Net Worth: $116.5 billion (+$43.9 billion)
  • 7. Alice Walton - Net Worth: $113.3 billion (+$43.2 billion)
  • 8. Rob Walton - Net Worth: $114 billion (+$42.8 billion)
  • 9. Sergey Brin - Net Worth: $161 billion (+$41 billion)
  • 10. Michael Dell - Net Worth: $114.6 billion (+$36.1 billion)
  • 11. Changpeng Zhao - Net Worth: $63.2 billion (+$28.9 billion)
"Elon Musk continues to lead the world's billionaires with a staggering net worth of $442.3 billion."

This year saw many billionaires, including major figures like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos, benefiting largely from advancements in technology and industry growth, solidifying their positions atop global wealth rankings.
newTitle: Top Billionaires Who Added the Most Wealth in 2024

title: New Honda Activa 125 launched at Rs 94,422 - BikeWale
summary:
New Honda Activa 125 launched at Rs 94,422

Publication Date: Updated
Source: BikeWale

Honda has introduced an updated Activa 125 which features minor styling changes and significant upgrades in technology. The scooter will be available for sale soon in two variants.

  • The Activa 125 will be sold in two variants: DLX priced at Rs 94,422 and H-Smart priced at Rs 97,146.
  • It features a new 4.2-inch TFT display with Bluetooth compatibility.
  • The engine is OBD 2B compliant and retains the same power output as the outgoing model.
  • An idling stop system is included to improve fuel efficiency.
  • The scooter comes in six colors and is available across all showrooms in India.
  • It competes with the TVS Jupiter 125 and the Suzuki Access 125.
newTitle: New Honda Activa 125 launched at Rs 94,422

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos to marry Lauren Sanchez in $600m ceremony at Kevin Costner's ranch: report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez to Marry in Lavish $600 Million Ceremony

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Jeff Bezos and his fiancée, Lauren Sanchez, are set to celebrate their wedding in Aspen, Colorado, with a budget of approximately $600 million for the event scheduled on December 28. The couple has opted for a winter-themed celebration at the luxury restaurant Matsuhisa.

  • The wedding venue has been reserved exclusively for elite guests from December 26 to 27.
  • About 180 guests are expected to attend the star-studded event, following the couple's engagement festivities in Italy.
  • Details about the wedding remain tightly under wraps, with NDAs for vendors involved.
  • Five-star hotels and private mansions have been booked for guests in Aspen.
“The wedding and accompanying celebrations will cost the couple a staggering $600 million.”

This lavish event marks a significant chapter in the lives of Bezos and Sanchez, highlighting their high-profile relationship and commitment.
newTitle: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez to Marry in Lavish $600 Million Ceremony

title: Proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted: Randeep Surjewala after U.S. court verdict on Pegasus - The Hindu
summary:
Randeep Surjewala Highlights Targeting of 300 Indian WhatsApp Users After U.S. Court Verdict on Pegasus

Published on: December 22, 2024 10:47 am IST | Source: The Hindu

A recent U.S. court ruling holding Israel's NSO Group accountable for its spyware, Pegasus, has sparked criticism from Congress leader Randeep Surjewala, who pointed out that the verdict reinforces allegations that 300 WhatsApp numbers in India were targeted.

  • The U.S. judge ruled in favor of Meta Platforms’ WhatsApp in a lawsuit against NSO Group.
  • Surjewala emphasized the importance of revealing the identities of the targeted individuals.
  • WhatsApp had previously sued NSO for accessing its servers to install spyware.
  • The case will now proceed to trial on the issue of damages.
  • Will Cathcart, Head of WhatsApp, called the ruling a victory for privacy.
“The #PegasusSpyware case verdict proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted in the illegal spyware racket.” — Randeep Singh Surjewala

In conclusion, the court ruling raises important questions regarding privacy and accountability, highlighting the need for transparency about the individuals affected by the Pegasus spyware.
newTitle: Randeep Surjewala Highlights Targeting of 300 Indian WhatsApp Users After U.S. Court Verdict on Pegasus

title: "Proves how 300 WhatsApp numbers of Indians were targeted": Randeep Surjewala after U.S. court verdict on Pegasus - The Hindu

summary:

Honda has launched the updated Activa 125 in India, featuring enhanced aesthetics and functionality.

  • The updated Activa 125 is priced at Rs 94,422 (DLX variant) and Rs 97,146 (H-Smart variant).
  • New color options include Pearl Igneous Black, Matt Axis Gray Metallic, Pearl Deep Ground Gray, Pearl Siren Blue, Rebel Red Metallic, and Pearl Precious White.
  • The new instrument console includes a 4.2-inch TFT display with Bluetooth connectivity for navigation and alerts.
  • The Activa retains its 123.9cc engine, producing 8.3bhp and 10.5Nm of torque, with CVT gearbox and idling start-stop feature.
“The updated Honda Activa 125 gets added features and new color options.”

The 2025 Honda Activa 125 offers a blend of classic design and modern features, catering to the evolving needs of customers.

title: Outlook 2025: Top fund managers remain bullish on Indian stock market, suggest these 4 sectors to invest in | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Outlook 2025: Fund Managers Optimistic About Indian Stock Market Investments

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Market veterans and fund managers believe the Indian stock market is positioned for growth despite global challenges. They anticipate a revival in consumption and investment as key drivers for the market next year.

  • Fund managers are optimistic about the market, viewing current economic slowdowns as temporary.
  • They expect growth to recover with increased government and corporate spending in the second half of the year.
  • Key sectors for investment include IT, banks, FMCG, and infrastructure.
  • The shift in global supply chains presents opportunities for India to play a significant role.
  • Emerging industries like battery storage and green hydrogen are highlighted as future growth drivers.
"With a growing middle class and a favourable business environment, India can emerge as a key global economic player..." - Karan Doshi, Fund Manager.

The consensus among experts is that 2025 will provide robust opportunities for investors in various sectors as structural growth factors continue to support the Indian economy.

title: Donald Trump transfers nearly $4 billion worth of his Trump Media shares to revocable trust | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Donald Trump Transfers Nearly $4 Billion Worth of Trump Media Shares to Revocable Trust

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

US President-elect Donald Trump has transferred all his stake in Trump Media & Technology worth over $4 billion to a revocable trust of which he is the sole beneficiary.

  • Trump transferred 114.75 million shares, representing 53% of the company’s stock, as a “bona fide gift” to the Donald J. Trump Revocable Trust.
  • Trump’s son, Donald Trump Jr., is the sole trustee with voting and investment power.
  • Trump previously stated he had no intention of selling his shares in the company.
  • Trump Media was created after Trump's social media ban following the January 6 Capitol riot.
  • The company went public on NASDAQ in March 2024, with shares experiencing volatility.
  • As of Friday, Trump Media shares were down about 2% at $34.71.
“Trump Media shares have remained volatile and the stock touched intraday highs near $80 on the first day of trading.”

In conclusion, the transfer of shares to a revocable trust might indicate a strategic financial maneuver by Trump, though the reasons remain unclear.
newTitle: Donald Trump Transfers Nearly $4 Billion Worth of Trump Media Shares to Revocable Trust

title: Zomato upends tradition with Sensex entry | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Zomato upends tradition with Sensex entry

Publication Date: Monday

Source: Live Mint

This article discusses Zomato's historic inclusion in the BSE Sensex, making it the first new-age tech stock to join the prestigious index, replacing JSW Steel. This event highlights a significant shift in the Indian business landscape, indicating the growing importance of the digital sector.

  • Zomato becomes the first tech stock in BSE Sensex.
  • It replaces JSW Steel in a routine half-yearly rebalancing.
  • The move underscores the prominent role of tech in the Indian economy.
"This signals a significant shift in the Indian business landscape."

The inclusion of Zomato in the Sensex is not just a win for the company but also a representation of the increasing influence of digital platforms in traditional markets.
newTitle: Zomato Joins BSE Sensex, Marking a Milestone for Tech Stocks

title: US judge rules Israel's NSO Group liable for hacking WhatsApp using Pegasus spyware - The Times of India
summary:
US Judge Rules Israel's NSO Group Liable for Hacking WhatsApp Using Pegasus Spyware

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

A US judge has determined that Israel's NSO Group is liable for utilizing the Pegasus spyware to hack into WhatsApp, raising significant concerns about privacy and surveillance.

  • The ruling comes as part of a legal battle involving NSO Group and the messaging platform, WhatsApp.
  • Pegasus is a powerful spyware that can access messages, calls, and other private data on targeted devices.
  • This case marks a notable moment in the ongoing debate around digital privacy and the ethics of surveillance technologies.
“This ruling underscores the serious implications of hacking and surveillance on personal privacy.”

This decision may lead to greater scrutiny of surveillance practices and potential regulation of spyware technology.
newTitle: US Judge Holds Israel's NSO Group Accountable for WhatsApp Hacking via Pegasus Spyware

title: Transrail Lighting IPO: Latest GMP, review, subscription status, other details; Issue ends on Monday— Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Transrail Lighting IPO: Latest GMP, review, subscription status, other details; Issue ends on Monday— Apply or not?

Publication Date: December 19, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Transrail Lighting's IPO was completely subscribed in just hours after bids opened, with significant interest from retail and non-institutional investors.

  • The IPO was subscribed 5.31 times overall as of Friday, December 20.
  • Retail investors' shares were subscribed at a rate of 6.90 times.
  • Non-institutional investors showed even more interest with a subscription rate of 7.23 times.
  • The QIB category had a subscription level of 1.38 times.
  • The price band for the IPO was set between ₹410-432 per share.
  • The offering will close on December 23, 2023, after generating ₹245.97 crore through the anchor book.
  • At the top of the price range, the IPO values Transrail Lighting at ₹839 crore, with a total market capitalization of approximately ₹5,600 crore.
  • Transrail Lighting specializes in power transmission and distribution and has integrated manufacturing facilities.
  • The latest GMP is ₹186, with an estimated listing price of ₹618.
“Transrail Lighting stands out as a prominent EPC company in India.”

Investors are encouraged to consider the strong subscription rates and the company's standing in the market.
newTitle: Transrail Lighting IPO: Latest GMP and Subscription Status

title: WhatsApp Wins Lawsuit Against Pegasus Maker As US Judge Finds NSO Guilty In Spyware Case - News18
summary:
WhatsApp Wins Lawsuit Against NSO Group in Spyware Case

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

WhatsApp has achieved a legal victory against the NSO Group, which is known for developing the Pegasus spyware. A US judge ruled that NSO Group violated US hacking laws and WhatsApp's terms of service.

  • WhatsApp filed the lawsuit accusing NSO of hacking 1,400 individuals in May 2019.
  • The judge ruled in favor of WhatsApp, stating that NSO's actions were illegal.
  • A jury trial is scheduled for March 2025 to determine the damages owed to WhatsApp.
  • WhatsApp emphasized the need for accountability for spyware companies targeting vulnerable groups.
  • NSO was found to be non-cooperative during the case and faced sanctions for not providing necessary information.
  • The US government blacklisted NSO in 2021, prohibiting its agencies from utilizing its products.
NSO must be held accountable for targeting journalists, human rights activists, and civil society groups.

This ruling marks a significant win for WhatsApp in its ongoing battle against spyware and underscores the rising scrutiny on tech companies involved in such practices.
newTitle: WhatsApp Wins Lawsuit Against NSO Group in Spyware Case

title: Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate - NDTV
summary:
Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate

Publication Date: November 14, 2023

Source: Undisclosed

This article discusses the ongoing debate about work hours in India, sparked by comments from Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy regarding a 70-hour workweek. Judges from 'Shark Tank India', Namita Thapar and Anupam Mittal, share their contrasting views on the subject.

  • Anupam Mittal believes that productivity cannot be measured by hours worked.
  • Namita Thapar argues for reasonable work limits for regular employees to protect their health and well-being.
  • Thapar highlights the disparity between high-level stakeholders and regular employees regarding workload expectations.
  • The debate was reignited by Narayana Murthy's call for increased productivity among India's youth.
Anupam Mittal: "I think it is a big lie... you are not going to achieve anything extraordinary in life by counting the hours that you are putting in."
Namita Thapar: "Basically this whole discussion... is a crock of bullsh*t."

In conclusion, the debate raises important questions about work-life balance and the implications of excessive work hours on health and family life.
newTitle: Shark Tank Judges Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate

summary:
Mukesh Ambani Acquires 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group for $10 Million

Publication Date: December 21, 2023 | Source: India.com

In a major move, billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries announced that its wholly owned subsidiary, Reliance Digital Health Ltd, is set to acquire a 45 percent stake in US-based healthcare firm Health Alliance Group Inc for $10 million. The investment aims to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform.

  • The investment is part of Reliance's strategy to improve healthcare access for underserved communities.
  • No related party transactions are involved.
  • The transaction is expected to be completed in around two weeks.
  • Health Alliance Group Inc specializes in technology-driven solutions for healthcare across the US and India.
“The investment will empower Reliance Digital to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform, expanding access to healthcare for underserved communities.” - Reliance Industries

This acquisition reinforces Reliance Industries’ commitment to expanding its footprint in the healthcare sector and enhancing technological integration in health services.
newTitle: Mukesh Ambani Acquires 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group for $10 Million

IRFC Share Price: Should you BUY top railway stock in 2025? - ET Now
summary:
IRFC Share Price: Should you BUY top railway stock in 2025?

Updated on: Dec 20, 2024 - Source: ET NOW

IRFC, a company under the Ministry of Railways, had issued its shares at Rs 26 through IPO and has delivered an impressive return of over 800%, reaching an all-time high of Rs 229.05 in July 2024. However, after a sharp correction, the stock is now trading at a 33% discount, closing at Rs 153 on NSE.

Key Points

  • Experts recommend investing in IRFC for long-term returns of 6-12 months or more.
  • The railway sector is undergoing transformation focused on infrastructure development and enhancing passenger experience.
  • IRFC shares have delivered positive returns of 52% in BSE data, with impressive multibagger returns over 365% and 570% in the last two and three years, respectively.
  • The company boasts a dividend yield of 0.98% and a market valuation of Rs 1,99,752.11 crore.
Gaurang Shah, market expert: "An IRFC investor should invest only if he/she has long-term views... you will be rewarded very good."

Overall, investing in IRFC is perceived as a long-term strategy given the current market corrections.
newTitle: IRFC Share Price: Should you BUY top railway stock in 2025?
